description:
Teaching compilers with python

Presented by Dr. Matthieu Amiguet

Why choose Python to teach compilers?

In the University of Applied Sciences ARC, compilers are taught in a
relatively short amount of time. Focus is put on the main conceptual
ideas, letting aside many technical details. Still, the students are
expected to write a full compiler within a few weeks' time.

After trying the traditional C/Lex/Yacc based approach, and a more
education- oriented Java/Jaccie solution, we settled on Python and PLY,
plus a few enhancements (syntax tree graphical representation, decorator
to achieve better code separation).

As a result, the students get a better understanding of the compiler
concepts and produce more interesting and creative projects.
